title: How to Repair the Motor Coupler in a Kenmore Washer

steps.headline: Unplug washer or disconnect power.
Turn off the water to the washer.
steps.description: (Do NOT skip this step if you are going to completely remove the water pump down the line.)

steps.headline: Pull the machine out far enough to tip it back against the wall.
steps.description: (Make sure to over center the CG behind the back legs when you tip it back or brace the front end up in the air.)

steps.headline: Disconnect the wire harness from the motor.
steps.description: (Both the connecter and the separate wire.)

steps.headline: Remove the two snap clamps from the water pump (Do NOT disconnect the water lines or you will have a bit of mess).
steps.description: Stowe the pump up out of the way. Mine fit nicely above the plate above its location.Remove the two pump clamps from the motor.

steps.headline: Remove the cabinet from the base:
Remove the motor.
steps.description: (May take a little bit of force to dislodge it from the rubber grommets)  Do NOT panic if the grommets come off with the motor. Do NOT rest the motor on either driveshaft.

steps.headline: Remove the bad coupler.
steps.description: The new metal re-enforced couplers may need a little motivation to be installed. Tap VERY LIGHTLY with a 1.5" rubber mallet, so as not to damage the gearbox.

steps.headline: Reinstall the motor.
steps.description: Snap the motor clamps back into place. Tighten down the 1/4" snap clamp screws.

steps.headline: Remove the pump:
Remove the drive motor:
Pry or break the motor couplings off of the drive shaft and gear case shaft.
Push one of the new plastic motor couplings on the shaft of the drive motor.
Push the other new plastic motor coupling on the shaft of the gear case.
Place the new rubber isolation coupling on the drive motor coupling by lining up the holes in the isolation with the studs in the coupling, and then push on.
Turn the isolation a coupling on the drive motor lining up the holes with the studs on the other coupling on the gear case.
Replace the drive motor.
Replace the pump.
steps.description: You may need to turn the pump, do so in the correct direction of the rotation of the pump. Snap the pump clamps back into place.

steps.headline: Replace the cabinet.
Reconnect the wire harness and extra wire to the motor.
Put the washer back down on all fours.
Plug in washer or reconnect power.
